poem:
"Chicanery Under Dire Roofs"

So much depends
upon
the leaking
roof.

Enticed by builders'
patter,
false storefronts riddle
trust.

Upon thirteen thousand
pounds,
dreams of shelter
drown.

While under the
half-built roof,
Unrepaired, unremitting,
pain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
